slokas: धृतराष्ट्र उवाचधर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सव: ।मामका: पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय ॥ १ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Dhṛtarāṣṭra said: O Sanjaya, what did the Pāṇḍavas and the Pāṇḍavas do with their festivities assembled in the field of Kurukṣetra in the field of Dharma?
slokas_english: Dhṛtarāṣṭra said: O Sanjaya, what did the Pāṇḍavas and the Pāṇḍavas do with their festivities assembled in the field of Kurukṣetra in the field of Dharma?

slokas: सञ्जय उवाचदृष्ट्वा तु पाण्डवानीकं व्यूढं दुर्योधनस्तदा ।आचार्यमुपसङ्गम्य राजा वचनमब्रवीत्  ॥  २ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Sanjaya saw the army of the Pāṇḍavas arranged at the army of the Pāṇḍavas and the king approached the ācārya and addressed him as follows
slokas_english: Sanjaya saw the army of the Pāṇḍavas arranged at the army of the Pāṇḍavas and the king approached the ācārya and addressed him as follows

slokas: पश्यैतां पाण्डुपुत्राणामाचार्य महतीं चमूम् ।व्यूढां द्रुपदपुत्रेण तव शिष्येण धीमता ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O teacher look at this great army of the sons of Pāṇḍu by your wise disciple the son of Drupada
slokas_english: O teacher look at this great army of the sons of Pāṇḍu by your wise disciple the son of Drupada

slokas: अत्र श‍ूरा महेष्वासा भीमार्जुनसमा युधि ।युयुधानो विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Here the great archer Bhīma and Arjuna are equal to Bhīma and Arjuna in battle Virata and Drupada the great charioteer
slokas_english: Here the great archer Bhīma and Arjuna are equal to Bhīma and Arjuna in battle Virata and Drupada the great charioteer

slokas: धृष्टकेतुश्चेकितानः काशिराजश्च वीर्यवान् ।पुरुजित्कुन्तिभोजश्च शैब्यश्च नरपुङ्गवः ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Dhrishtaketu and Chekitana were the mighty king of Kāśī and the mighty Purujit Kuntibhoja
slokas_english: Dhrishtaketu and Chekitana were the mighty king of Kāśī and the mighty Purujit Kuntibhoja

slokas: युधामन्युश्च विक्रान्त उत्तमौजाश्च वीर्यवान् ।सौभद्रो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्व एव महारथाः ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Yudhamanyu and Vikranta Uttamauja were the mighty Saubhadra and Draupadi and all the great charioteers
slokas_english: Yudhamanyu and Vikranta Uttamauja were the mighty Saubhadra and Draupadi and all the great charioteers

slokas: अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम ।नायका मम सैन्यस्य संज्ञार्थ तान्ब्रवीमि ते ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O best of the brāhmaṇas listen to those who are distinguished by us
slokas_english: O best of the brāhmaṇas listen to those who are distinguished by us

slokas: भवान्भीष्मश्च कर्णश्च कृपश्च समितिंजयः ।अश्वत्थामा विकर्णश्च सौमदत्तिस्तथैव च ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): You are Bhishma Karna Kripa Samitinjaya Ashvatthama Vikarna and also Saumadatti
slokas_english: You are Bhishma Karna Kripa Samitinjaya Ashvatthama Vikarna and also Saumadatti

slokas: अन्ये च बहवः श‍ूरा मदर्थे त्यक्तजीविताः ।नानाशस्त्रप्रहरणाः सर्वे युद्धविशारदाः ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Many other brave men gave up their lives for My sake They were all experts in warfare
slokas_english: Many other brave men gave up their lives for My sake They were all experts in warfare

slokas: अपर्याप्त‍ं तदस्माकं बलं भीष्माभिरक्षितम् ।पर्याप्त‍ं त्विदमेतेषां बलं भीमाभिरक्षितम् ॥ १० ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): The strength of ours is protected by Bhīma and is protected by Bhīma
slokas_english: The strength of ours is protected by Bhīma and is protected by Bhīma

slokas: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागवमस्थिताः ।भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्तः सर्व एव हि ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): May all of you protect Bhishma in all the ayana in their proper way
slokas_english: May all of you protect Bhishma in all the ayana in their proper way

slokas: तस्य सञ्जनयन्हर्षं कुरुवृद्धः पितामहः ।सिंहनादं विनद्योच्च‍ैः शङ्खं दध्मौ प्रतापवान् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): The mighty grandfather of the Kurus shook the roar of the roar of the lion's conchshell and blew his conchshell
slokas_english: The mighty grandfather of the Kurus shook the roar of the roar of the lion's conchshell and blew his conchshell

slokas: ततः शङ्खाश्च भेर्यश्च पणवानकगोमुखाः ।सहसैवाभ्यहन्यन्त स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत् ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Then suddenly the sounds of the conches and the drums and the horns of the cowherd boys became tumultuous
slokas_english: Then suddenly the sounds of the conches and the drums and the horns of the cowherd boys became tumultuous 13

slokas: ततः श्वेतैर्हयैर्युक्ते महति स्यन्दने स्थितौ ।माधवः पाण्डवश्चैव दिव्यौ शङ्खौ प्रदध्मतुः ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Then the two divine conchshells, Mādhava and the Pāṇḍavas, arranged in a great chariot with white horses.
slokas_english: Then the two divine conchshells, Mādhava and the Pāṇḍavas, arranged in a great chariot with white horses. 14

slokas: पाञ्चजन्यं हृषीकेशो देवदत्तं धनञ्जयः ।पौण्ड्रं दध्मौ महाशङ्खं भीमकर्मा वृकोदरः ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): The son of Pāñcājanya and the son of Dṛṣīkeśa, the son of Dyāsa, blew the great conchshell and Bhīmakarma.
slokas_english: The son of Pāñcājanya and the son of Dṛṣīkeśa, the son of Dyāsa, blew the great conchshell and Bhīmakarma. 15

slokas: अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः ।नकुलः सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): King Yudhisthira, the son of Kunti, the son of Nakula, the son of Sughosha and Manipushpaka
slokas_english: King Yudhisthira, the son of Kunti, the son of Nakula, the son of Sughosha and Manipushpaka. 16 The great sage Kāśya and the great archer Shikhandi were the great charioteers Dhṛṣṭādyumna and Virāta and Satyaki were also defeated 17 O lord of the earth the mighty-armed Draupadi and Draupadi blew their conches in all respects 18

slokas: काश्यश्च परमेष्वास: शिखण्डी च महारथ: ।धृष्टद्युम्न‍ो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्‍चापराजित: ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): The great sage Kāśya and the great archer Shikhandi were the great charioteers Dhṛṣṭādyumna and Virāta and Satyaki were also defeated

slokas: द्रुपदो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वश: पृथिवीपते ।सौभद्रश्च महाबाहु: शङ्खान्दध्मु: पृथक्पृथक् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O lord of the earth the mighty-armed Draupadi and Draupadi blew their conches in all respects

slokas: स घोषो धार्तराष्ट्राणां हृदयानि व्यदारयत् ।नभश्च पृथिवीं चैव तुमुलोऽभ्यनुनादयन् ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): The sound of the sons of Dhṛtarāṣṭra tore the hearts of the sons of Dhṛtarāṣṭra and the tumultuous sound of the sky and the earth and the earth .
slokas_english: The sound of the sons of Dhṛtarāṣṭra tore the hearts of the sons of Dhṛtarāṣṭra and the tumultuous sound of the sky and the earth and the earth 19.

slokas: अथ व्यवस्थितान्दृष्ट्वा धार्तराष्ट्रान्कपिध्वजः ।प्रवृत्ते शस्त्रसम्पाते धनुरुद्यम्य पाण्डवः ।हृषीकेशं तदा वाक्यमिदमाह महीपते ॥ २० ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Seeing the sons of the sons of Kapi who was standing there in the midst of a weapon the son of Pāṇḍu arranged the bow of the son of Pāṇḍu who was in accordance with the weapons of the sons of Pāṇḍu
slokas_english: Seeing the sons of the sons of Kapi who was standing there in the midst of a weapon the son of Pāṇḍu arranged the bow of the son of Pāṇḍu who was in accordance with the weapons of the sons of Pāṇḍu 20

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचसेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये रथं स्थापय मेऽच्युत ।यावदेतान्निरीक्षेऽहं योद्‍धुकामानवस्थितान् ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Arjuna said: O infallible one, I have observed the chariot between the two armies, O infallible one, as long as I have seen these men standing there.
slokas_english: Arjuna said: O infallible one, I have observed the chariot between the two armies, O infallible one, as long as I have seen these men standing there. 21 What should I fight with me in this battle? 22

slokas: कैर्मया सह योद्धव्यमस्मिन्‍रणसमुद्यमे ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): What should I fight with me in this battle?

slokas: योत्स्यमानानवेक्षेऽहं य एतेऽत्र समागताः ।धार्तराष्ट्रस्य दुर्बुद्धेर्युद्धे प्रियचिकीर्षवः ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): I looked at the men who had assembled here in this battle for the sake of the wicked Dhṛtarāṣṭra who wished to please him
slokas_english: I looked at the men who had assembled here in this battle for the sake of the wicked Dhṛtarāṣṭra who wished to please him 23

slokas: सञ्जय उवाचएवमुक्तो हृषीकेशो गुडाकेशेन भारत ।सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये स्थापयित्वा रथोत्तमम् ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Sanjaya said: Thus addressed by Gudakesha, O descendant of Bharata, the best of chariots was placed in the middle of the two armies.
slokas_english: Sanjaya said: Thus addressed by Gudakesha, O descendant of Bharata, the best of chariots was placed in the middle of the two armies. 24

slokas: भीष्मद्रोणप्रमुखतः सर्वेषां च महीक्षिताम्  ।उवाच पार्थ पश्यैतान्समवेतान्कुरुनिति ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O son of Pṛthā, please look at these assembled by Bhīṣma and Drona and all the kings of the earth. .
slokas_english: O son of Pṛthā, please look at these assembled by Bhīṣma and Drona and all the kings of the earth. 25.

slokas: तत्रापश्यत्स्थितान्पार्थः पितॄनथ पितामहान्।आचार्यान्मातुलान्भ्रातॄन्पुत्रान्पौत्रान्सखींस्तथा।श्वश‍ुरान्सुहृदश्चैव सेनयोरुभयोरपि ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): There he saw the fathers and grandfathers the teachers his maternal uncles brothers sons and friends the fathers and friends of both the armies .
slokas_english: There he saw the fathers and grandfathers the teachers his maternal uncles brothers sons and friends the fathers and friends of both the armies 26.

slokas: तान्समीक्ष्य स कौन्तेयः सर्वान्बन्धूनवस्थितान्  ।कृपया परयाविष्टो विषीदन्निदमब्रवीत् ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Overcome with mercifulness Kaunteya looked at all his relatives and spoke these words in a state of depression and addressed them as follows
slokas_english: Overcome with mercifulness Kaunteya looked at all his relatives and spoke these words in a state of depression and addressed them as follows 27

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचदृष्ट्वेमं स्वजनं कृष्ण युयुत्सुं समुपस्थितम्  ।सीदन्ति मम गात्राणि मुखं च परिश‍ुष्यति ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Arjuna said: O Kṛṣṇa, when I saw this relative of this people, my limbs were traced to fight. .
slokas_english: Arjuna said: O Kṛṣṇa, when I saw this relative of this people, my limbs were traced to fight. 28.

slokas: वेपथुश्च शरीरे मे रोमहर्षश्च जायते ।गाण्डीवं स्रंसते हस्तात्त्वक्च‍ैव परिदह्यते ॥ २९ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): My body is trembling and my hair is thrilled and my skin is burnt by the skin of the body. .
slokas_english: My body is trembling and my hair is thrilled and my skin is burnt by the skin of the body. 29.

slokas: न च शक्न‍ोम्यवस्थातुं भ्रमतीव च मे मनः ।निमित्तानि च पश्यामि विपरीतानि केशव ॥ ३० ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O Keśava, I cannot be able to stand in the sky and see my mind in the opposite directions. .
slokas_english: O Keśava, I cannot be able to stand in the sky and see my mind in the opposite directions. 30.

slokas: न च श्रेयोऽनुपश्यामि हत्वा स्वजनमाहवे ।न काङ्क्षे विजयं कृष्ण न च राज्यं सुखानि च ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O Kṛṣṇa, I do not see any good in killing my relatives in battle. O Kṛṣṇa, I do not desire victory, nor kingdom, nor pleasures.
slokas_english: O Kṛṣṇa, I do not see any good in killing my relatives in battle. O Kṛṣṇa, I do not desire victory, nor kingdom, nor pleasures. 31

slokas: किं नो राज्येन गोविन्द किं भोगैर्जीवितेन वा ।येषामर्थे काङ्‍‍क्षितं नो राज्यं भोगाः सुखानि च ॥ ३२  ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O Govinda, what is the use of our kingdom or pleasures, what is the use of our lives for the sake of whom we desire kingdom and pleasures?
slokas_english: O Govinda, what is the use of our kingdom or pleasures, what is the use of our lives for the sake of whom we desire kingdom and pleasures? 32 The teachers fathers fathers and grandfathers were leaving their lives in battle 33 I do not wish to kill these maternal uncles dogs, grandsons, brothers and relatives. 34 O Janardana, what is the use of killing Dhṛtarāṣṭra for the sake of the earth for the sake of the kingdom of the three worlds? 35.

slokas: त इमेऽवस्थिता युद्धे प्राणांस्त्यक्त्वा धनानि च ।आचार्याः पितरः पुत्रास्तथैव च पितामहाः ॥ ३3॥
slokas_english(no numbers): The teachers fathers fathers and grandfathers were leaving their lives in battle

slokas: मातुलाः श्वश‍ुराः पौत्राः श्यालाः सम्बन्धिनस्तथा ।एतान्न हन्तुमिच्छामि घ्न‍तोऽपि मधुसूदन ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): I do not wish to kill these maternal uncles dogs, grandsons, brothers and relatives.

slokas: अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतोः किं नु महीकृते ।निहत्य धार्तराष्ट्रान्नः का प्रीतिः स्याज्ज‍नार्दन ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O Janardana, what is the use of killing Dhṛtarāṣṭra for the sake of the earth for the sake of the kingdom of the three worlds?

slokas: पापमेवाश्रयेदस्मान्हत्वैतानाततायिनः ।तस्मान्नार्हा वयं हन्तुं धार्तराष्ट्रान्सबान्धवान् ।स्वजनं हि कथं हत्वा सुखिनः स्याम माधव ॥ ३६ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): They are the only ones who take refuge in the sin of killing us and are not worthy to kill the sons of Dhṛtarāṣṭra and their relatives .
slokas_english: They are the only ones who take refuge in the sin of killing us and are not worthy to kill the sons of Dhṛtarāṣṭra and their relatives 36.

slokas: यद्यप्येते न पश्यन्ति लोभोपहतचेतसः ।कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं मित्रद्रोहे च पातकम् ॥ ३७
slokas_english(no numbers): Although these men are overwhelmed with greed and have destroyed their family, they are sinful in their companions and sin in betraying their friends.
slokas_english: Although these men are overwhelmed with greed and have destroyed their family, they are sinful in their companions and sin in betraying their friends. 37 O Janardana how can we not know how to escape our sins 38.

slokas: ॥कथं न ज्ञेयमस्माभिः पापादस्मन्निवर्तितुम् ।कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं प्रपश्यद्भ‍िर्जनार्दन ॥ ३८ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O Janardana how can we not know how to escape our sins

slokas: कुलक्षये प्रणश्यन्ति कुलधर्माः सनातनाः ।धर्मे नष्टे कुलं कृत्स्नमधर्मोऽभिभवत्युत ॥ ३९ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): The eternal religious duties of a family are destroyed when their religious duties are destroyed .
slokas_english: The eternal religious duties of a family are destroyed when their religious duties are destroyed 39.

slokas: अधर्माभिभवात्कृष्ण प्रदुष्यन्ति कुलस्त्रियः ।स्त्रीषु दुष्टासु वार्ष्णेय जायते वर्णसङ्करः ॥ ४० ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O Kṛṣṇa, because of the influence of irreligion, O Kṛṣṇa, the women of the family are polluted, O Vārṣṇi, the confusion of castes is born in the wicked.
slokas_english: O Kṛṣṇa, because of the influence of irreligion, O Kṛṣṇa, the women of the family are polluted, O Vārṣṇi, the confusion of castes is born in the wicked. 40

slokas: सङ्करो नरकायैव कुलघ्न‍ानां कुलस्य च ।पतन्ति पितरो ह्येषां लुप्तपिण्डोदकक्रियाः ॥ ४१ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): The mixture of the mixtures of the family kills the families of the families of the family, and the fruits of their lost bodies and water. .
slokas_english: The mixture of the mixtures of the family kills the families of the families of the family, and the fruits of their lost bodies and water. 41.
